Introduction: Renowned Russian piano teacher Irina Sousatzka gets a new student - Bengali piano prodigy Manek. They are both immigrants in the UK and bond quickly. When Manek's single mother's business fails, he must make a career decision.

Name: Midnight Express (1978)

Name: Misery (1990)

Name: Mr. Saturday Night (1992)
Introduction: The life of Buddy Young, a comic legend in flashbacks but an old man looking for work in the present.

Name: Murphy's Romance (1985)
Introduction: Emma moves to a ranch with her son after a divorce and befriends the older Murphy, but things turn complicated when her ex shows up.

Name: My Life (1993)
Introduction: A terminally ill man prepares for his death.

Name: Solaris (1972)
Introduction: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane.

Name: Network (1976)
Introduction: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.

Name: No Way Out (1987)
Introduction: A coverup and witchhunt occur after a politician accidentally kills his mistress.

Name: North Dallas Forty (1979)
Introduction: A satire of American professional football in which a veteran pass-catcher's individuality and refusal to become part of the team family is bitterly resented by his disciplinarian coaches.

Name: The Odd Couple: Together Again (1993)
Introduction: Felix's daughter Edna is getting married, and his wife Gloria throws him out of the house for a few days, so that she can plan the wedding herself, without him getting in the way. Felix

Name: The Outlaw Josey Wales (1976)
Introduction: Missouri farmer Josey Wales joins a Confederate guerrilla unit and winds up on the run from the Union soldiers who murdered his family.

Name: Black and White (1999)
Introduction: Thriller starring Gina Gershon as hard-edged, experienced cop Nora 'Hugs' Hugosian, who is assigned a new partner - rookie cop Chris O'Brien (Rory Cochrane) - to help her with the serial

Name: Frequency (2000)
Introduction: An accidental cross-time radio link connects father and son across 30 years. The son tries to save his father's life, but then must fix the consequences.

Name: Ready to Rumble (2000)
Introduction: Two slacker wrestling fans are devastated by the ousting of their favorite character by an unscrupulous promoter.

Name: Return to Me (2000)
Introduction: A man who falls in love with the woman who received his wife's heart must decide which woman it is who holds his heart.

Name: Rules of Engagement (2000)
Introduction: An attorney defends an officer on trial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians after they stormed a U.S. embassy in a Middle Eastern country.
Stars: Tommy Lee Jones|Samuel L. Jackson|Guy Pearce

Name: Joe Gould's Secret (2000)
Introduction: Around 1940, The New Yorker staff writer Joe Mitchell meets Joe Gould, a Greenwich Village character, who is writing a voluminous Oral History of the World, a record of twenty thousand conversations he's overheard.

Name: Me, Myself & Irene (2000)
Introduction: A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates.

Name: Bell Book and Candle (1958)
Introduction: A modern-day witch likes her neighbor but despises his fiancée, so she enchants him to love her instead.

Name: John Goodman/Andrew Rannells/The 1975/Keith Carlock
Introduction: John Goodman (Broadway play "The Front Page"); Andrew Rannells (Broadway musical "Falsettos"). Also: The 1975 performs; Keith Carlock sits in with The 8G Band.

Name: The Game/The End of Violence/L.A. Confidential/The Disappearance of Garcia Lorca
Introduction: Add a Plot »

Introduction: During World War II, several oddly assorted military experts are teamed in a mission to raid and destroy a bridge vital to enemy strategy.

Name: How to Stuff a Wild Bikini (1965)
Introduction: Frankie, on naval-reserve duty in Tahiti, doesn't trust Dee Dee to stay faithful, so he hires Bwana, a witch doctor, to help. Bwana conjures up a floating bikini, "stuffs" it with Cassandra

Name: Mystery Train (1989)
Introduction: Three stories are connected by a Memphis hotel and the spirit of Elvis Presley.

Name: Sacco e Vanzetti (1971)
Introduction: The story of two anarchists who were charged and unfairly tried for murder when it was really for their political convictions.

Name: Taffin (1988)
Introduction: An Irish tough-guy debt collector is asked by his local community to help rid the town of developers bent on building a chemical plant on the outskirts of town. The developers are ruthless

Name: Arthur (1981)
Introduction: Alcoholic billionaire playboy Arthur Bach must marry a woman he does not love, or he will be cut off from his $750,000,000 fortune. But when Arthur falls in love with a poor waitress, he must decide if he wants to choose love or money.

Name: Bachelor Party (1984)
Introduction: A soon-to-be-married man's friends throw him the ultimate bachelor party.

Name: Parenthood (1989)
Introduction: The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.

Name: Predator (1987)
Introduction: A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.

Name: The Prince of Tides (1991)
Introduction: A troubled man talks to his suicidal sister's psychiatrist about their family history and falls in love with her in the process.

Name: The Postman Always Rings Twice (1981)
Introduction: The sensuous wife of a lunch wagon proprietor and a rootless drifter begin a sordidly steamy affair and conspire to murder her Greek husband.

Name: Smoking/No Smoking (1993)
Introduction: An examination of the possible consequences of a certain event.

Name: All the Vermeers in New York (1990)
Introduction: Anna, a French actress, is approached by financial broker Mark in the Vermeer room of a New York gallery. However, romance does not ensue.

Name: À nous la liberté (1931)
Introduction: Seeking better life, two convicts escape from prison.

Name: Yukinojô henge (1963)
Introduction: Yukinojo, a Kabuki actor, seeks revenge by destroying the three men who caused the deaths of his parents. Also involved are the daughter of one of Yukinojo's targets, two master thieves, and a swordsman who himself is out to kill Yukinojo.

Name: 28 Days (2000)
Introduction: A big-city newspaper columnist is forced to enter a drug and alcohol rehab center after ruining her sister's wedding and crashing a stolen limousine.

Name: American Psycho (2000)
Introduction: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

Name: Keeping the Faith (2000)
Introduction: Two friends, a priest and a rabbi, fall in love with the same woman they knew in their youth, but the religious position of both men denies them romance.

Name: Where the Money Is (2000)
Introduction: Old bank robber Henry, paralyzed from a stroke, is moved from a prison hospital to a retirement home, where Carol is a nurse. She doesn't believe he's paralyzed and sees him as a way out of her boring life.

Name: East Is East (1999)
Introduction: In early 1970s England, a Pakistani father finds the authority he has previously maintained challenged by his increasingly Anglicized children.

Name: The Filth and the Fury (2000)
Introduction: A film about the career of the notorious punk rock band, the Sex Pistols.

Name: Passion of Mind (2000)
Introduction: A psychological romantic thriller where fantasy and reality become indistinguishable for a woman leading a double life in her dreams.

Name: Third World Cop (1999)
Introduction: A police officer returns to his neighborhood in Kingston, Jamaica to find himself in conflict with his childhood friend who is now the right-hand-man of the local gang-lord in a gun-running racket. Jamaica's highest-grossing film to date.

Name: Coming Apart (1969)
Introduction: Psychiatrist installs a concealed movie camera in his apartment to record the screwed-up lives of the women who visit him.

Name: Diner (1982)
Introduction: A group of college-age buddies struggle with their imminent passage into adulthood in 1959 Baltimore.

Name: Shakes the Clown (1991)
Introduction: Shakes is good at his job as party clown - when he's sober and shows up. Five druggy clowns frame him for the murder of his boss.
